packagesAvailableToErrata

public static DataResult packagesAvailableToErrata(Errata errata,
                                                   User user,
                                                   PageControl pc)
Returns a dataResult containing all of the packages available to an errata. Picks the right query depending on whether or not the errata is published.

Parameters:
errata - The errata in question
user - The user requesting the list
pc - The page control for this user
Returns:
Returns the list of packages available for this particular errata.

Parameters:
errata - The errata in question
cid - The channel id, we want packages in this channel
user - The user requesting the list
pc - The page control for this user
Returns:
Returns the list of packages available for this particular errata in this particular channel.

isPackageInChannel

public static boolean isPackageInChannel(java.lang.Long cid,
                                         java.lang.Long nameid,
                                         java.lang.Long evrid)
Returns true if the package whose name and evr id are passed in exists in the given channel whose id is cid.

Parameters:
cid - Channel id
evrid - package evr id
nameid - package name id
Returns:
true if package exists in channel.

getServerNeededUpdatePackageByName

public static java.lang.Long getServerNeededUpdatePackageByName(java.lang.Long sid,
                                                                java.lang.String packageName)
Get the ID of the package that needs updating based on the name. So, if say the server has up2date version 2.8.0 and the latest rev of up2date is 3.1.1 this will return the ID of the package for 3.1.1

Parameters:
sid - of system
packageName - of system - up2date for example
Returns:
Long id of package if found. null if not.

lookupEvrIdByPackageName

public static java.util.Map lookupEvrIdByPackageName(java.lang.Long sid,
                                                     java.lang.String name)
Find the most up to date package with the given name accessible to a system with the given system id.

Parameters:
sid - The id of a system to which the package must be accessible.
name - The exact name of the package sought for.
Returns:
A map with keys 'name_id' and 'evr_id' containing Long types. Null if nothing found.

lookupPackageName

public static PackageName lookupPackageName(java.lang.String name)
Lookup a package name.

Parameters:
name - Package name to lookup.
Returns:
PackageName associated with the given string name.

packageNamesByCapability

public static DataResult packageNamesByCapability(Org org,
                                                  java.lang.String capabilityName)
Get the list of Package Names that match the passed in capability string. Example: "rhn.kickstart.boot_image" for the list of auto kickstart rpms

Parameters:
org - making the request
capabilityName - to search for
Returns:
DataResult containing *just* the package name strings

packageNamesByCapabilityAndChannel

                                                            java.lang.String capabilityName,
                                                            Channel chan)
Get the list of package names that match the passed in capability and channel.

Parameters:
org - making the request
capabilityName - to search for
chan - channel to search for
Returns:
DataResult containing *just* the package name strings

verCmp

public static int verCmp(java.lang.String epoch1,
                         java.lang.String version1,
                         java.lang.String release1,
                         java.lang.String epoch2,
                         java.lang.String version2,
                         java.lang.String release2)
Compares an evr to another evr.

Parameters:
epoch1 - Epoch 1
version1 - Version 1
release1 - Release 1
epoch2 - Epoch 2
version2 - Version 2
release2 - Release 2
Returns:
Returns 1 if EVR1 > EVR2, -1 if EVR1 < EVR2, and 0 if EVR1 == EVR2.

deletePackage

public static void deletePackage(User user,
                                 Package pkg)
                          throws PermissionCheckFailureException
Deletes a package from the system

Parameters:
user - calling user
pkg - package to delete
Throws:
PermissionCheckFailureException - - caller is not an org admin, the package is in one of the RH owned channels, or is in different org

possiblePackagesForPushingIntoChannel

public static DataResult possiblePackagesForPushingIntoChannel(java.lang.Long cid,
                                                               java.lang.Long eid,
                                                               PageControl pc)
Looks at a published errata and a channel and returns a list of PackageComparisons containing the packages that the errata has more recent versions of and may be pushed into the channel by the user

Parameters:
cid - channel id
eid - errata id
pc - PageControl object needed to handle pagination issues.
Returns:
DataResult of PackageComparisons

lookupReleasePackageFor

public static InstalledPackage lookupReleasePackageFor(Server server)
Given a server this method returns the redhat-release package. This package is a marker package and holds information like the rhel release and can be futher queried to get the evr information.

Parameters:
server - the server object who has to be queried
Returns:
the redhat release package or null if the package can't be found..

lookupPackageNameOverview

public static DataResult lookupPackageNameOverview(Org org,
                                                   java.lang.String packageName,
                                                   java.lang.String[] channelarches)
Returns package metadata for all packages named 'packageName' and exist in the channels whose arch is one of the 'channelArches'.

Parameters:
org - The users Org.
packageName - Name of package being sought.
channelarches - list of valid channel arches. i.e.
  • channel-ia32
  • channel-ia64
  • channel-sparc
  • channel-alpha
  • channel-s390
  • channel-s390x
  • channel-iSeries
  • channel-pSeries
  • channel-x86_64
  • channel-ppc
  • channel-sparc-sun-solaris
  • channel-i386-sun-solaris
Returns:
package metadata for all packages named 'packageName' and exist in the channels whose arch is one of the 'channelArches'.

Returns package metadata for all packages named 'packageName' and exist in the channels which which the orgId is subscribed.

Parameters:
org - The users Org.
packageName - Name of package being sought.
Returns:
package metadata for all packages named 'packageName' and exist in the channels which which the orgId is subscribed.
